intro: Asyneuma canescens subsp. canescens, commonly known as the hairy asyneuma, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant is distinguished by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine hairs, providing it with a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The flowers, which are usually yellow or orange, bloom in the summer months and attract various pollinators.
